title: Sogrape 2016 Quinta de Azevedo White (Vinho Verde)
description: The elegant Minho stone manor house is the heart of this fine vineyard. The wine, still with a light prickle on the tongue, is a classic from the Vinho Verde region, crisp, incisive and packed with fruit. Drink this tangy wine now.

title: Studert-Prüm 2016 Wehlener Sonnenuhr Kabinett Riesling (Mosel)
description: Ripe tangerines are accented by notes of caramel, crushed earth and fennel in this earthy, slightly savory kabinett. Bristling lemon acidity and honey tones brighten the midpalate, leading a finish edged by spice and a hint of tannins.

title: Veramar 2013 Estate Club Merlot (Virginia)
description: This wine offers aromas and flavors of baked red currant, red plum, eucalyptus, black pepper and rare meat. Its zippy acidity is a great match for the full body and depth of flavors.

title: Winter's Hill 2014 Cuvée du Vigneron Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)
description: This winemaker's selection is from a warm ripe vintage, yet it remains rather light. The fruit touches on pomegranate and raspberry, and a whiff of ground coffee suggests some time in a percentage of new or once-used oak. It's light on the palate and stiffly herbal through the finish.

title: Winter's Hill 2015 Reserve Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)
description: The winery makes a number of block and clone cuvées, along with regular and reserve Pinots. It would perhaps differentiate them as well as showcase them more distinctively to focus on blending fewer, more complete wines. This reserve has the same high acid, herbal, earth and stem character as the regular bottling.

title: Wolfberger 2016 Edelzwicker White (Alsace)
description: Just a touch of fresh apple appears on the almost mute nose. The palate follows with easy, clean apple and ripe pear notes on a slender, light body. The finish is dry and refreshing. Drink soon.

title: Charles & Charles 2016 Chardonnay (Washington)
description: This wine's aromas include notes of yellow apple, melon and lees. The palate brings a rounded feel, showing little apparent new-oak influence. It's a straightforward, varietally correct wine.

title: Château Bégadan 2015  Médoc
description: Grapes from mainly young vines in this blend of Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon are given a firm texture by the serious amount of wood aging that brings in mint and spice as well as toast. The wine's black-currant character is still developing. Drink from 2023.

title: Château Cayla 2015  Cadillac Côtes de Bordeaux
description: Aged in wood for 12 months, this blend of 70% Merlot and 30% Cabernet Sauvignon is already balanced and stylish. Its wood aging has added spice without masking any of the black-currant fruit. Drink this wine from 2019

title: Château la Rose de Vitrac 2015  Bordeaux
description: Produced in the heart of the Entre-deux-Mers region, this wine is rich, young and fruity. And that's the way it should be, because this is not a wine for aging but for enjoying with its black fruits and ripe texture. Drink from mid-2018.

title: Château Patache d'Aux 2015  Médoc
description: Named after the stagecoach that used to stop here on its way up the Médoc, this wine is light, with soft blackberry fruits and acidity. An easy wine that's likely to mature quickly, it should be ready from 2019.

title: Anam Cara 2015 Nicholas Vineyard Gewürztraminer (Chehalem Mountains)
description: This very sweet, 210g/l dessert wine was produced cryogenically. It's peachy and syrupy, with candied apricots and a touch of maple syrup. There's just enough acidity to cut some of the treacle, but the sweetness has a sugary granularity rather than a smooth, integrated mix of flavors.

title: Avensole 2013 Sole Serenade Red (Temecula Valley)
description: Baked licorice leads the nose on this blend of 74% Merlot and 26% Cabernet Franc, along with thyme and stewed elderberries. The mouthfeel is lighter bodied, carrying flavors of exotic marjoram and red currant.

title: Bestheim 2016 Anne de K Pinot Blanc (Alsace)
description: The nose is closed and does not want to give too much away. The palate, however, has lovely lemon and fresh pear fruit on a rather light, dry body. This is fresh, easy and fairly neutral, but clean and fresh. Drink soon.

title: Boomtown 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Fruit-forward aromas of black currant and plum lead to plump, easy-drinking fruit flavors. It's straightforward, though it seems to lack concentration, especially in the middle.

title: Botanica 2015 The Mary Delany Collection Semillon (Elgin)
description: Green pepper, melon, mango and pineapple aromas are sharp, yet bright, forming a lean and zippy impression. The palate follows through on that promise, with additional notes of lime leaf and mango skin that are somewhat at odds with the palate's round, full texture. Drink now.

title: Bott Frères 2016 Edelzwicker White (Alsace)
description: A neutral nose offers a quiet, lemony streak. The palate is equally neutral, almost dilute, but fresh and clean. Some apple and pear notes appear on the refreshing finish. Drink soon.

title: Allimant-Laugner 2016 Pinot Blanc (Alsace)
description: Nothing but the slightest hint of lemon appears on the closed nose. The palate is clean and fresh, just hinting at green pear. Drink soon.

title: Bèlon du Bèlon 2013 Instinct Brut Rosé  (Franciacorta)
description: You'll find aromas of toast, nut and a whiff of adhesive bandage on this. The aromas carry over the rather lean, somewhat muddled palate along with dried cherry, a hint of lead pencil, powdered sage and a confectionary note alongside steely bubbles.

title: Bèlon du Bèlon 2013 Satèn Party  (Franciacorta)
description: Toasted nut, medicinal herb and bread crust aromas follow through to the lean palate along with yellow-apple skin, sage and bitter almond. Fresh acidity and a vigorous perlage provide the backdrop.

title: Dr. Pauly Bergweiler 2016 Wehlener Sonnenuhr Kabinett Riesling (Mosel)
description: Ripe, sweet yellow peach and tangerine flavors are shaded by darker tones of smoke and sea water in this slightly rustic, savory kabinett. It's well balanced by acidity and the finish is refreshing and crisp.

title: José Maria da Fonseca 2016 Ripanço Private Selection Red (Alentejano)
description: This wine is ripe, soft, rich and smooth. Its tannins are totally integrated into the generous damson fruit. Lightly textured and with balanced acidity, the wine is ready to drink.

title: La Ciarliana 2014  Vino Nobile di Montepulciano
description: Underbrush, dried herb and toasted aromas lift out of the glass while the no-frills palate evokes wild cherry, ground clove and a hint of coffee bean. Fleeting tannins give loose support. Drink soon.

title: Melrose 2015 Baco Noir (Umpqua Valley)
description: Fleshy and simple, this is packed with flavors of strawberries. It's fresh and forward, with a ripe core of fruit. Don't look for complexity here, just enjoy it for its lush strawberry goodness.

title: Mignanelli 2014 Pinot Noir (Central Coast)
description: Intriguing aromas of dark pomegranate, white pepper, crushed gravel and herb meet with a touch of tar on the nose of this appellation blend. The mouthfeel is heavy and the density impresses, but the flavors of rich cranberry and tart orange rind are a bit muddled and sour.

title: Monte Rossa 2012 Cabuchon Brut  (Franciacorta)
description: Aromas of toasted walnut, yellow stone fruit and candied citrus zest follow through to the vigorous palate along with bitter yellow-apple skin and a hint of medicinal herb. Steely bubbles provide a rather aggressive perlage.

title: P.J. Valckenberg 2016 Pinot Blanc (Rheinhessen)
description: A hint of smoked nuts lends a savory tone to flavors of pressed apple and pear. While delicate in concentration, it's dry and approachable, with refreshing lemon-lime acidity. Drink now.

title: Paul Anheuser 2016 Blanc de Noir Pinot Noir (Nahe)
description: Slighty muted tones of strawberry and red apple are glazed with caramel in this slightly off-dry blanc de noir, a Pinot Noir vinfied like a white wine. Light bodied and soft in acidity, it's an easy, approachable wine to drink now.

title: Penley Estate 2016 Aradia Chardonnay (Coonawarra)
description: A ripe, rich, perfumed nose of butter, citrus, melon and yeast lead into a palate that feels a little disjointed, with a creamy, weighty texture yet biting acidity and very little fruit.

title: Poggio d'Elsa 2016  Maremma Toscana
description: Made with 70% Sangiovese and 30% Cabernet Sauvignon, this has subdued aromas of red plum and baking spice. The aromas carry over to the simple palate together with a hint of vanilla. Round tannins lend easy support.
